intro: Dentella linearis, commonly known as the slender dentella, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants like buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically greenish-white and appear in clusters, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Dentella linearis is often cultivated for its delicate foliage and ease of growth in well-drained soils.
